page.title: 03LANDSCAPE: ROCKS OF URCHFONT
page.content: In Urchfont there are three types of rock.Clay,chalk and greensand which the main part of Urchfont is settled on.The village is situated on the greensand because it is fertile and if it was on chalk there wouldn't be any water for a mile or so and if it was on clay it would be too wet because the water soaks through the chalk and through the greensand and hits the clay and it can't go through.So it turns to the north and comes out to make a spring on the escarpment between greensand and clay.Around Urchfont we grow cereals because it isn'too dry or wet and is easy to plough.But on the clay it is hard to plough and wet so they grow grass for cattle.In the greensand you can find a hard stone called malmstone which was used for building(with other
